trans-unit.source: Specifies whether a service operation accepts incoming transactions from a client.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.TransactionFlowAttribute> is an attribute used declaratively to associate a specific transaction flow policy with a service operation.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.TransactionFlowOption> property of this attribute specifies whether the respective operation accepts a transaction flowed from the client, or if the operation requires the client to always flow a transaction.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.TransactionFlowAttribute> can also be used as an operation behavior to programmatically associate a transaction flow policy with a specific operation.
In this case, it should be added to the `Behaviors` collection on the operation’s description.
The `OperationContract` for each method that uses the <xref:System.ServiceModel.TransactionFlowAttribute> must provide a fully-qualified `Action` string.
A value of "*" is not supported.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.TransactionFlowAttribute"></xref> class.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.TransactionFlowOption"></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the incoming transaction is supported.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.TransactionFlowOption"></xref> that indicates whether the incoming transaction is supported.
Adds extra parameters (settings) to the binding context to support this operation’s behavior.
This method cannot be inherited.
This method provides a binding context with the extra parameters (settings) to support the required behavior for this operation.
It is called internally by the infrastructure when a service is created.
The operation description for which the attribute adds extra functionality.
The collection of parameter objects on the binding context.
Attaches the attribute functionality to the `ProxyOperation` object for the method that the attribute marks.
This method cannot be inherited.
This method allows you to view, modify, or add custom extensions to the client runtime across all messages, or for a specific operation.
Note that in the case of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.TransactionFlowAttribute>, the implementation of this method is empty.
This method is called internally by the infrastructure when a service proxy is created.
The operation to which the attribute attaches functionality.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientOperation"></xref> object that represents the current operation.
Attaches the attribute functionality to the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.DispatchOperation"></xref> object for the method that the attribute marks.
This method cannot be inherited.
This method allows you to view, modify, or add custom extensions to the client runtime across all messages, or for a specific operation.
Note that in the case of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.TransactionFlowAttribute>, the implementation of this method is empty.
This method is called internally by the infrastructure when a service is created.
The description for this operation.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.DispatchOperation"></xref> object for this operation.
Verifies that the operation can support this behavior.
This method cannot be inherited.
This method verifies whether the operation description is sufficient to support the transaction flow behavior.
Note that in the case of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.TransactionFlowAttribute>, the implementation of this method is empty.
This method is called internally by the infrastructure when a service is created.
The operation to validate.
